summary: Force is a push or pull that can change the state of motion or shape of an object. Acceleration produced by a net force is proportional to the force and inversely proportional to mass. Pressure is force per unit area.

concepts.name: Force
concepts.definition: A push or pull on an object that can change its motion or shape.

concepts.name: Contact vs Non-contact Forces
concepts.definition: Contact forces act by touching (friction, muscular); non-contact act at a distance (gravitational, magnetic, electrostatic).

concepts.name: Balanced & Unbalanced Forces
concepts.definition: Balanced forces cancel out and cause no change in motion; unbalanced forces result in acceleration.

concepts.name: Pressure in Fluids
concepts.definition: Fluids exert pressure in all directions; pressure increases with depth.

faq.q: Why does a nail pierce wood more easily than a finger?
faq.a: Same force on a much smaller area gives higher pressure, so the nail pierces the wood.

faq.q: How are force and acceleration related?
faq.a: Directly proportional for a fixed mass: doubling force doubles acceleration (F = m × a).
